meanings.definition: The process of combining or arranging photographs or images to create a new composition.
meanings.sent1: Photocomposition involves putting together different pictures to make a new image.
meanings.sent2: She learned about photocomposition in her art class.
meanings.sent3: The photocomposition of the family photos made everyone look like they were at a party.
meanings.sent4: His photocomposition of nature scenes was like a beautiful puzzle coming together.
meanings.sent5: The book cover was a stunning example of photocomposition.

meanings.definition: The result of combining or arranging photographs or images to create a new composition.
meanings.sent1: The photocomposition on the poster caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The magazine cover was a perfect example of photocomposition.
meanings.sent3: The photocomposition of the landscape photos made it look like a dream.
meanings.sent4: Her photocomposition of the city skyline was a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The photocomposition of the album cover was striking and memorable.
